id: How do computers check simple strings as if A = B ? We humans can easily check if two numbers or sentences are the same , but ho do computers , at their deepest level , know how to compare things ? Please explain like I'm five.
text: ['Computers perform operations on the binary representations of alphanumeric characters . For example , A is 01000001 , and B is 01000010 . Subtracting two strings should result in all zeroes if they are identical .', 'Believe it or not , it \'s done mostly the same way humans do it . A human might compare numbers by looking at the digits : 456 and 458 are easy to check : the first digit is the same , the second one is as well and the third one is different , therefore the two numbers are different . After you \'ve done this hundreds of times , you get very good at it and can do it at a glance . Computers do the same thing but never get any better at it . Instead of using decimal digits , most represent numbers as a string of [ binary digits ] ( URL_0 ) ( " bits " for short ) . There \'s a circuit in the processor that puts the bits from both numbers side by side , checks each corresponding pair of bits to see if they \'re the same and sets a flag that indicates whether or not the comparison found them all the same . The characters in strings are stored internally as groups of numbers , usually encoded using a standard numbering scheme such as [ ASCII ] ( URL_1 ) . For example , ASCII numbers A as 65 , B as 66 , C as 67 and D as 68 . The string ABC would be stored as a 65 followed by a 66 followed by a 67 . If you were to compare the strings ABC and ABD , you \'d find that the first two characters in both strings were A and B and the third was different between them ( C and D ) and conclude that the strings differ . A computer does exactly the same thing : it examines the pairs of corresponding characters between the strings and compares their numbers using the method I described above . If all of the numbers compare as equal , the strings are equal ; if any differ , they \'re unequal .', 'In C , there is a function to compare the strings character by character . The first character of the first string is compared to the first character of the second string , and so on . As soon as a difference is found , it returns either -1 , which means that the first string is before the second string , 1 , which means the first string is after the second string , or 0 , which means they are equal .']

id: How do you safely get rid of nuclear waste ? Please do n't use words with over 7 letters , those are too hard . Explain like I'm five.
text: ["Put it in strong barrels , put barrels in a cave that is n't near a water source . Hope the barrels do n't leak for many many many many many many years .", "Use it up . Most nuclear waste can be re - processed into usable fuel , which can then be put back into the reactor ... The parts that are n't worth putting back into the reactor , are the parts that are easiest to store . The reason this is n't done is political , rather than technical . Uranium is mostly what goes into the reactors , and plutonium is mostly what comes out , and refined plutonium is GREAT for making bombs , so we intentionally do n't reprocess the fuel . At this point though , it seems pointless . If North Korea has nukes , then anyone can have them and we might as well deal with the waste properly .", "There are different kinds of nuclear waste . - High - level nuclear waste ( the kind you 're probably thinking of , waste fuel rods , etc . ) . They mix it into liquid glass , pour it into steel barrels , put it in underground salt caverns , and wait for 200,000 years , hoping the under - water cave never floods . The danger of this is not the radioactivity . It is the toxicity of the waste . ~~It takes a few grains of spent fuel to poison an entire lake.~~ * The toxicity is estimated to be between 114 and 136 mg U / kg . * - Medium and low level nuclear waste ( the metal from the reactor , the water that was cycled through the reactor , etc . ) Let it sit for 20 years or so and you 're good to go . - Mining trailings ( the dirt that you got the radioactive materials from ) . Throw it in a pile somewhere and hope it is n't rained on too much . But the safest way ? Use it up . Current reactors in the US use about 0.5 % of the usable fuel in them . Breeder reactors use closer to 50 % , and produce waste that is only dangerous for 20,000 years instead . We do n't use this , though , because it is the same process you use to make nuclear weapons . A safer way still ? Thorium - cycle reactors . Safer still ? Fusion reactors . Edit : my numbers may be off . Correct me if I 'm wrong . Edit 2 : you asked what is the safe way to dispose . The current way to dispose is to place the waste into a cooling pool for several years , then dump it in a steel barrel and store it on the nuclear power plant parking lot . Pretty much anything else is safer . There is no place anywhere in the world that permanently stores nuclear waste long - term . A facility was built in Nevada , but after Nevada took the money for construction , they changed their minds about storing nuclear waste . Edit 3 : Thank you /u / FoxFluffFur for giving me better information on the toxicity !"]

If you have concerns about a gas station selling drug paraphernalia, you can contact your local authorities or speak to the management of the gas station."]

id: How do you convince a solider to shoot at the civilians of his own country ? Is n't that what 's going on in Syria for the past few months ? Do n't the soliders realize that they are fighting against their own interests ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
['It is never appropriate or acceptable for soldiers to shoot at civilians, no matter what the circumstances. Doing so goes against the principles of human rights and the laws of war, which are meant to protect civilians from harm.

It is also important to note that soldiers are not always given a choice about whether or not to follow orders. In many cases, soldiers are required to follow orders given to them by their superiors, even if they believe those orders to be wrong or unethical. This can be a difficult and confusing situation for soldiers, who may feel torn between their duty to follow orders and their own moral convictions.

In situations like the one you describe, it is important for soldiers to speak up and report any illegal or unethical orders they are given. They can also seek guidance from their superiors or military lawyers to help them determine the right course of action.

It is also important for civilians to try to stay safe during times of conflict and to seek help from organizations that are working to protect their rights and safety.']

id: How do large cities not run out of number and letters combinations to put on license plates ? What would happen if they did ? Title . Explain like I'm five.
text: ["In large cities, there are usually so many different cars that it's unlikely that they would run out of combinations of letters and numbers to use for license plates. If a city did run out of combinations, they could simply create more combinations by using more letters or adding more numbers to the plates. For example, they might use a combination of three letters and three numbers instead of just two of each.\\n\\nIt's also possible for a city to recycle old license plate combinations that are no longer in use. For example, if someone gets a new car and gets a new license plate, the old plate and its combination of letters and numbers would be available to be used again.\\n\\nOverall, it's not likely that a city would run out of combinations for license plates, but if it did happen, there are ways to create more combinations or recycle old ones to solve the problem."]

id: How do things dry ? Let 's say I spill a glass of water on my wooden floor . After a while , it 's just not there anymore . Where does this water go ? Explain like I'm five.
text: ['Sure! When you spill a glass of water on your floor, the water starts to spread out and cover more of the floor. The water molecules are very tiny and can move around easily. As the water touches the floor, it starts to evaporate, which means that the water turns from a liquid into a gas. When water evaporates, it turns into water vapor, which is a type of gas. The water vapor rises into the air and floats around until it finds something cold to touch. When it touches something cold, the water vapor turns back into a liquid and forms tiny droplets on the surface. This is called condensation. So, when you spill water on your floor and it disappears, it has actually just evaporated into the air and turned into water vapor. The water vapor has then risen up into the air and turned back into tiny droplets of water on the cold surface.']

id: How do we know that the colors we see are the actual colors ? Is the color red actually red or is it just red to our eyes ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
["The colors we see are the colors that our eyes and brain perceive based on the wavelengths of light that are reflected or emitted by different objects. The colors we see are not necessarily the same colors that exist in the world, but rather they are our perception of the colors of light waves.

For example, the color red is a color that our eyes and brain perceive when we see light waves with wavelengths between about 620 and 750 nanometers. When light waves with these wavelengths bounce off an object and enter our eyes, they stimulate the cells in our retina and our brain perceives the color red.

So, in a way, the color red is actually red to our eyes, because that is how our eyes and brain perceive it. But it's important to remember that the color red is not an inherent property of an object, like its shape or size. It is simply our perception of the wavelengths of light that are reflected or emitted by the object."]

id: How do dividends of the underlying security in a security futures contract affect the security futures price?
text: ["When a company declares a dividend on its underlying stock, the price of the stock typically decreases by an amount equal to the dividend on the ex-dividend date, which is the date on which the stock begins trading without the dividend. This is because the dividend is paid out of the company's profits, and the value of the company's profits is reflected in the stock price.The price of a security futures contract is derived from the price of the underlying stock, so the dividend will also affect the price of the security futures contract. The value of the security futures contract is based on the value of the underlying stock minus the value of the dividend that will be paid out. Therefore, when the stock goes ex-dividend, the price of the security futures contract will typically decrease by an amount equal to the dividend.It's important to note that the effect of a dividend on the price of a security futures contract can be more complex than this simple explanation, as other factors such as supply and demand, market conditions, and the current level of interest rates can also affect the price of the contract."]

id: How do computers recognize different styles of code ? I realize that computers read code as 0 's and 1 's , but how do they determine the difference between python , and javascript ? Or other languages . Explain like I'm five.
text: ["When you write code in a programming language, you are writing instructions that the computer can follow to perform a specific task. Different programming languages use different sets of rules and conventions for writing these instructions, such as the use of specific keywords, syntax, and other elements that are unique to that language.\\n\\nWhen you want to run your code, you use a program called a compiler or interpreter to translate the code you've written into a form that the computer can understand and execute. The compiler or interpreter looks at the code you've written and compares it to the rules and conventions of the programming language you are using. If the code follows the rules of the language, the compiler or interpreter will translate it into machine code (the 0's and 1's that computers understand) and run it. If the code doesn't follow the rules of the language, the compiler or interpreter will give you an error message telling you where the problem is.\\n\\nSo, in short, computers recognize different styles of code by using compilers or interpreters that are designed to understand the specific rules and conventions of each programming language."]

id: How does a computer know if a binary code is a letter or a number ? According to [ this ] ( URL_0 ) , 01100001 = a. How does the computer know that it 's not 97 ? And optionally : how does ASCII codes work ? Explain like I'm five.
text: ['In order to understand how a computer knows if a binary code represents a letter or a number, we need to first understand how computers store and represent data. Computers store data using bits, which are units of information that can have one of two values: 0 or 1. When we group several bits together, we can represent different types of data, such as letters, numbers, and symbols. One way that computers can represent letters and numbers is by using a code called ASCII (American Standard Code for Information Interchange). ASCII is a standard that assigns a unique number to each letter, number, and symbol in the English language. For example, the ASCII code for the letter "A" is 65, the ASCII code for the letter "B" is 66, and so on. So when a computer sees a binary code like 01100001, it knows that this code represents a letter because it has been programmed to recognize the ASCII codes for letters. In this case, the computer knows that 01100001 is the ASCII code for the letter "a". I hope this helps to explain how computers know whether a binary code represents a letter or a number. Let me know if you have any other questions!']

id: How does a key fob authenticator work ? How does this offline device generating random numbers grant access to bank accounts etc ? Explain like I'm five.
text: ['\\nA key fob authenticator is a small device that is used to provide an extra layer of security when accessing certain accounts or systems. It works by generating random numbers, which are used as a type of "password" to grant access to the account or system.\\n\\nHere\'s how it works: When you want to access your account or system, you will need to enter a username and password, as well as a code from your key fob authenticator. The key fob will generate a new, randomly-generated code every time you need to access the account or system.\\n\\nWhen you enter the code from your key fob into the login screen, the system will check the code against a database of valid codes. If the code you entered is on the list of valid codes, the system will grant you access to the account or system. If the code is not on the list, the system will not grant you access.\\n\\nKey fob authenticators are useful because they provide an extra layer of security by requiring a randomly-generated code in addition to a username and password. This makes it more difficult for someone to gain unauthorized access to your account or system, because they would need to know both your username and password, as well as have access to your key fob.\\n\\nOverall, key fob authenticators work by generating random numbers that are used as a type of "password" to grant access to accounts or systems, providing an extra layer of security to protect against unauthorized access.\\n']

id: How do Penny Auctions make money ? Searched here and did n't find an answer . :/ Explain like I'm five.
text:
["Penny auctions are a type of online auction where users can bid on items by paying a small fee for each bid. The winning bidder gets the item at a price that is typically much lower than its retail value.

Penny auctions make money by charging users a fee for each bid they make. For example, if a user wants to bid on an item that is being sold for $100, they might have to pay a fee of $0.50 for each bid they make. If they make 10 bids, they would have to pay a total of $5.00 in fees.

The penny auction website makes a profit because the total amount of money that users pay in fees is usually greater than the final sale price of the item. For example, if the winning bid on an item is $20 and the total amount of money paid in fees is $50, the penny auction website would make a profit of $30.

It's important to note that penny auctions can be risky for users because they can end up paying a lot of money in fees without winning the auction. It's also important to read the fine print and understand the rules of the penny auction before participating."]

They are able to detect the smell of these foods from a distance, and they are drawn to them to lay their eggs. When a fruit fly lays eggs, it will look for a moist, warm place to do so. If you have an overripe banana or other sweet, fermented food out in the open, this can be an attractive place for a fruit fly to lay its eggs. The eggs will then hatch into larvae, which will feed on the fermented material and eventually emerge as adult fruit flies. So, when you see a swarm of fruit flies around your banana, it is likely because the flies were attracted to the smell of the overripe fruit and laid their eggs on or near it. The eggs then hatched into larvae, which grew into adult flies and are now swarming around the banana.']

id: How do refrigerators work ? How does the cooling process work ? What 's going on at the back in that little tank ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
["Sure! Refrigerators work by using a coolant liquid that absorbs heat and turns into a gas, and a compressor that pressurizes the gas and pumps it through a series of coils. The coils on the outside of the fridge give off heat as the gas cools and turns back into a liquid, and the cooled liquid is then circulated back into the fridge to absorb more heat.

The little tank at the back of the fridge is called the evaporator, and it's where the coolant liquid turns into a gas. The gas absorbs heat from the inside of the fridge and cools the air inside. The compressor then pumps the hot gas through the coils on the outside of the fridge, where it gives off the heat and cools back down into a liquid. This process is repeated over and over again to keep the fridge cool.

So basically, the fridge uses a special liquid that can absorb heat and turn into a gas to cool the inside of the fridge. The compressor helps the liquid do its job by pressing it and making it hot, and the coils on the outside of the fridge help the liquid give off the heat and cool back down. Does that make sense?"]

id: How does a computer ACTUALLY work ? Like , how does it transfer , read , and display data and things . Something I 've personally always wondered . Please explain like I'm five.
text: ['Sure! I\'ll do my best to explain how a computer works in a way that\'s easy to understand. A computer is a machine that can perform tasks, like storing and retrieving information, doing calculations, and communicating with other devices. At the heart of a computer is the central processing unit (CPU), which is the "brain" of the computer. It reads and executes instructions that tell the computer what to do. The instructions that the CPU follows are called programs. Programs are written in a special language called code, which is a set of instructions that the computer can understand and follow. The CPU reads the instructions in a program and carries them out by manipulating data. Data is information that a computer can use, like numbers, text, or pictures. The CPU can read data from storage devices, like a hard drive or a USB flash drive, and it can also receive data from other devices, like a keyboard or a mouse. The CPU stores data in its own memory, called RAM (random access memory). RAM is like a workspace where the CPU can access and manipulate data quickly. When the computer is turned off, the data in RAM is lost. The CPU also sends and receives data to and from other parts of the computer, like the display, which is the screen you see, and the speakers, which produce sound. The CPU sends the data to these devices through wires called cables, which are connected to the motherboard (the main circuit board inside the computer). So to summarize, a computer works by reading and executing instructions from programs, manipulating data, and sending and receiving data to and from other parts of the computer and devices. I hope that helps! Is there anything else you\'d like to know about how a computer works?']

id: How do they measure how fast a continent is moving ? For example , URL_0 Edit : Thanks for all the replies , everyone . Please explain like I'm five.
text: ["Scientists measure the speed at which a continent is moving by using a tool called GPS, or Global Positioning System. GPS is a network of satellites that orbit the Earth and send signals down to the ground. By using GPS receivers, scientists can measure the distance between the satellites and the receiver on the ground very accurately. By measuring the distance between the satellite and the receiver at different times, scientists can calculate how fast the continent is moving.For example, let's say that there is a GPS receiver on a continent, and a satellite orbiting the Earth above it. The satellite sends a signal down to the receiver, and the receiver measures how long it takes for the signal to reach it. The receiver can then calculate how far away the satellite is based on how long it took for the signal to reach it.If the scientists measure the distance between the satellite and the receiver again a few hours later, they can see how far the continent has moved in that time. By dividing the distance the continent has moved by the time it took to move that distance, scientists can calculate how fast the continent is moving.I hope that helps! Is there anything else you'd like to know?"]

id: How do speakers generate sound ? Subquestion : why is it that smaller heaphones usually ca n't product strong bass sounds compared to bigger speakers ? Explain like I'm five.
text: ['Speakers generate sound by using a diaphragm (usually a cone or dome shape) that moves back and forth very quickly. The movement of the diaphragm creates changes in air pressure, which are then detected by our ears as sound.\n\nThe size of the speaker and its diaphragm can affect the types of sounds it can produce. Larger speakers and diaphragms can generally produce lower frequency sounds, such as bass, more easily because they have more mass and can move more air. Smaller speakers and diaphragms, on the other hand, are better at producing higher frequency sounds because they can move more quickly. This is why smaller headphones often have trouble producing strong bass sounds compared to larger speakers.']

id: How do the people who illustrate dinosaurs know what colours they are ? How do they know their skin was of a greenish colour and their texture for the skin . Please explain like I'm five.

id: How do artificial flavourings work ? Do you mix a bunch of chemicals and end up with a strawberry tasting substance , is it just a process of concentrating the original food , or something else completely ? Explain like I'm five.
text: ['Artificial flavorings are made by mixing different chemicals together to create a substance that tastes like a particular food or drink. These chemicals are often derived from natural sources, such as plants and spices, but they can also be made in a laboratory.\\n\\nTo create a strawberry-flavored substance, for example, a flavorist (a scientist who specializes in creating flavors) might mix together chemicals that have a fruity taste, a sweet taste, and a slightly tart or sour taste. These chemicals are combined in specific amounts to try to replicate the taste of a real strawberry as closely as possible.\\n\\nThe process of creating artificial flavorings can be complex and requires a lot of knowledge and skill. Flavorists have to understand how different chemicals interact with each other and how they will be perceived by the human tongue. They also have to consider how the flavor will be used â for example, whether it will be added to a drink, a candy, or a baked good â and how it will be affected by other ingredients or by heat.\\n\\nOverall, the goal of artificial flavorings is to create a substance that tastes like a particular food or drink, without actually using the real thing. This can be useful in situations where the real food is not available or is too expensive, or when it is difficult to get the desired flavor using natural ingredients.']

id: How do they fix dents in cars ? When your car gets hit and you get a dent , what 's the process a mechanic goes through to actually recover that part of the car ? Explain like I'm five.
text: ["There are a few different methods that mechanics use to repair dents in cars, and the method they choose will depend on the size and location of the dent, as well as the type of material the car is made of. Here are a few common methods:\\n\\nPushing the dent out from the inside: If the dent is small and located in an area where it's possible to access the back side of the panel (like the hood or a door), a mechanic might try to push the dent out from the inside using a special tool called a dent puller. The mechanic will use the dent puller to apply pressure to the back side of the dent, slowly working it back into its original shape.\\n\\nFilling and sanding the dent: If the dent is too large or too deep to be repaired by pushing it out, the mechanic might try to fill it in using a special body filler. The filler is a thick, gooey substance that can be smoothed over the dent to fill in the damaged area. Once it's dry, the mechanic will sand the area down until it's smooth and even with the rest of the car.\\n\\nPainting the repaired area: After the dent has been repaired, the mechanic will need to paint the area to match the rest of the car. They will first apply a layer of primer, which helps the paint adhere to the surface. Then they will apply several layers of paint, using a special tool called a spray gun to apply it evenly. Finally, they will apply a layer of clear coat, which helps protect the paint and give it a glossy finish.\\n\\nI hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions."]

id: How do captcha systems prevent spam ? Why has no one created a system of spamming around them ? What makes them so much harder to break then normal spam filters ? Please explain like I'm five.
text:
['Captcha systems are designed to prevent spam by requiring users to prove that they are human. This is usually done by showing the user an image with distorted text or a series of images with a specific pattern and asking them to enter the text or select the images that match the pattern. 
Spammers might try to use automated programs to send out large numbers of spam messages, but these programs would not be able to solve the captcha. Therefore, captcha systems can effectively block spam because they can distinguish between human users and automated programs. 
One reason that captcha systems are difficult to break is that they can be designed to be very difficult for a computer to interpret. For example, the text in the image might be distorted in a way that is easy for a human to read but hard for a computer to recognize. Similarly, the pattern of images might be difficult for a computer to recognize without the context that a human would naturally bring to the task. 
Overall, captcha systems are an effective way to prevent spam because they require humans to prove that they are human, which is something that automated programs cannot do.']

id: How does AI work in video games ? How can a machine react to human inputs intelligently ? Are there preprogrammed responses to each action ? Does the computer have a set strategy ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
["In video games, AI (artificial intelligence) refers to the way that computer-controlled characters (also known as NPCs, or non-player characters) behave and interact with the player and the game world.

There are different ways that AI can be used in video games, and the specific approach depends on the type of game and the goals of the developers. Here are a few common ways that AI is used in video games:

Preprogrammed responses: In some games, the AI characters may have a set of preprogrammed responses to certain actions or events. For example, an NPC might have a specific line of dialogue that they will always say when the player talks to them, or they might always run away if the player attacks them.

Decision-making: In other games, the AI characters might be able to make decisions based on their surroundings and the player's actions. For example, an NPC might choose to attack the player if they get too close, or they might decide to hide if the player is armed and looking for them.

Strategy: In games that involve strategic elements, such as strategy games or role-playing games, the AI characters might have a set strategy that they follow in order to achieve their goals. For example, an NPC might try to capture certain territory on a map, or they might try to gather resources in order to build up their strength.

Overall, the goal of AI in video games is to create the illusion of intelligent, believable behavior for the NPC characters. This can help make the game more immersive and engaging for the player."]

id: How do re - breathers ( the kind you see in movies and games like Battlefield ) work ? Friend and I were playing battlefield and got to thinking . Do they work like fish gills and just take the oxygen out of the water ? Thanks ! Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Rebreathers are devices that allow a person to breathe air that has already been exhaled. They are often used by divers, firefighters, and military personnel because they can be used in environments where there is not enough oxygen or where the air is contaminated.

Rebreathers work by recycling the exhaled air, removing the carbon dioxide, and adding more oxygen. The exhaled air is first passed through a canister filled with a chemical called a "scrubber," which absorbs the carbon dioxide. The air is then passed through a device called an "oxygen regulator," which adds more oxygen to the air before it is breathed in again.

Rebreathers can be used in water, but they do not work like fish gills. Fish gills extract oxygen from the water and exhale carbon dioxide, while rebreathers recycle exhaled air and add oxygen.']

id: How does a computer boot ? What is that which brings the hardware to life ? How does the code communicate with hardware to do things ? Please explain like I'm five.
text: ['Sure! When a computer is turned on, it goes through a process called "booting" to get itself ready to be used. This process is like a person waking up and getting dressed in the morning.The first thing that happens when the computer is turned on is that the hardware checks itself to make sure everything is working properly. This is called a "power-on self-test," or POST.Next, the computer looks for a special program called the "bootloader." The bootloader is a small piece of software that is stored on a chip on the computer\'s motherboard. It\'s kind of like a map that tells the computer where to find the rest of the operating system, which is the main program that runs on the computer and lets you do things like open and close programs, save and open files, and connect to the internet.Once the bootloader has been found, it loads the operating system into the computer\'s memory and then starts it. The operating system then takes control of the computer and starts running.To communicate with the hardware and do things, the computer uses something called "instructions." Instructions are like a set of step-by-step instructions that tell the computer what to do. The instructions are written in a special language called "code," which the computer can understand and follow.So, to sum it up: when you turn on a computer, the hardware checks itself, the bootloader loads the operating system, and the operating system uses instructions to communicate with the hardware and do things.']

id: How do we know what dead languages ( Latin , Ancient Greek , etc ) sounded like ? How do we know the pronunciation of these languages when they 've been dead for 100s of years and there 's no audio records of them being spoken ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Great question! To understand how we know what dead languages sounded like, we need to understand a little bit about how languages work.

Languages are made up of sounds called "phonemes," and each language has its own set of phonemes. When we write a language down, we use symbols called "letters" to represent the phonemes. For example, the word "cat" has three letters in it, but it is actually made up of three phonemes: "k," "a," and "t."

Dead languages like Latin and Ancient Greek are no different. Even though we don't have any audio recordings of these languages being spoken, we can still figure out how they were pronounced by looking at the letters that were used to write them down.

For example, in Latin, the letter "c" was pronounced differently than it is in English. In Latin, "c" was pronounced like the "k" sound in "cat." So, if we see the word "catus" written in Latin, we can guess that it was pronounced like "katus," with a hard "k" sound at the beginning.

There are also other clues that can help us figure out how a dead language was pronounced. For example, we can look at how words changed over time, or how they were borrowed into other languages. By looking at all of these clues together, we can get a pretty good idea of what dead languages sounded like.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.']

id: How do our lungs filter out dust and other particles in the air ? So I âve been working in an old warehouse which is covered in dust .. I have nât ingested much but I âm curious how / if it exits our lungs ? Explain like I'm five.
text: ['Sure! When we breathe in, the air goes down our windpipe and into our lungs. Inside our lungs, there are tiny little branches called bronchi and even tinier branches called bronchioles. At the end of these bronchioles are even smaller branches called alveoli.\\n\\nThe alveoli are surrounded by tiny blood vessels called capillaries. When we breathe in dust and other small particles, they can get stuck in the sticky mucus that lines the bronchi and bronchioles. Tiny hair-like structures called cilia that line the bronchi and bronchioles move back and forth in a coordinated way to sweep the mucus and trapped particles up and out of the lungs.\\n\\nThe mucus and particles then move up and out of the lungs through the windpipe, and we can cough or blow our nose to get rid of them. Our body also has special cells called macrophages that can eat up and remove any harmful particles that may have gotten past the mucus and cilia.\\n\\nSo even though you may be working in a dusty environment, your body has many ways of filtering out those particles and keeping your lungs healthy.']

text: ['Pension funds are financial plans that companies set up to provide retirement benefits for their employees. These funds are usually funded by the company, as well as by contributions from the employees themselves.A pension fund can get into a deficit if the amount of money in the fund is not enough to cover the cost of all the retirement benefits that have been promised to the employees. This can happen for a few reasons:The fund has not been properly managed: If the fund is not managed well, it can lose money due to poor investment decisions or other financial mistakes.The fund has been underfunded: If the company has not contributed enough money to the fund, it may not have enough to cover the cost of all the retirement benefits.The fund has too many liabilities: If the company has promised more in retirement benefits than it can afford to pay, the fund may end up with a deficit.The fund has been hit by an unexpected event: If the fund experiences a large, unexpected loss, such as a recession or a natural disaster, it may end up with a deficit.It is allowed for pension funds to have deficits because companies are required to follow certain rules when setting up and managing these funds. However, if a pension fund has a deficit, the company may be required to take steps to address the issue, such as by making additional contributions to the fund or finding other ways to reduce the deficit.Tata Steel is an example of a company that has a pension fund that is in a deficit. The company has had to take steps to address this issue, such as by offering retirement benefits to some employees that are different from what was originally promised.']

id: How do railguns work ? I would like some clarity on the act of actual projectile being fired . Please explain like I'm five.
text:
["Sure! A railgun is a type of gun that uses electricity to launch a projectile instead of gunpowder. It works by using two metal rails and a sliding armature to create a strong magnetic field. 
First, a very strong electrical current is passed through the rails. This creates a magnetic field that pushes against the armature, which is a conductive metal bar or rod that is mounted between the rails. When the magnetic field is strong enough, it can overcome the force of gravity and friction, causing the armature to slide along the rails at high speed. 
The armature is connected to the projectile, which is a small metal object that is meant to be launched from the gun. As the armature slides along the rails, it carries the projectile with it, propelling it out of the railgun and through the air. 
That's the basic idea, but there are a lot of technical details and engineering challenges involved in making a railgun work properly. Some railguns use additional components, such as a pulsed power supply or a plasma armature, to achieve even higher speeds and greater accuracy. 
I hope that helps! Let me know if you have any other questions."]

id: How do n't kilograms and pounds measure the same thing ? Just taking my first physics class this year and learned that kg measure mass while lbs measure weight , can someone explain why / how they measure two different quantities if both are measured by a scale ? Please explain like I'm five.
text: ["Kilograms and pounds are units of measurement used to describe the mass of an object. Mass is a measure of the amount of matter in an object, and it is the same no matter where you are in the universe. Weight, on the other hand, is a measure of the force exerted on an object due to gravity. The weight of an object depends on its mass and the strength of the gravitational field it is in.Here's an example to help illustrate the difference between mass and weight: Imagine you have a bag of potatoes that weighs 10 pounds on Earth. If you took that same bag of potatoes to the moon, which has a weaker gravitational field than Earth, the bag of potatoes would weigh less than 10 pounds because the force of gravity on the moon is weaker than it is on Earth. However, the mass of the bag of potatoes would still be the same, regardless of whether it is on Earth or the moon.So to summarize, kilograms and pounds are both used to measure mass, but weight is a measure of the force exerted on an object due to gravity and depends on the mass of the object and the strength of the gravitational field it is in."]

id: How does a computer delete data ? When you uninstall and empty your recycle bin what happens to the data ? Where does it go ? Does it get vaporized or just stored somewhere else or what ? Edit : Thanks ! Totally makes sense now ! Explain like I'm five.
text:
['When you delete a file on a computer, the operating system (such as Windows or MacOS) marks the space that file was using as available to be overwritten with new data. This means that the file is not actually removed from the hard drive or other storage device, but the system simply no longer keeps track of it and considers the space it was using to be free to use again.

When you empty the recycle bin, you are deleting the files permanently, so the operating system marks the space they were using as available to be overwritten. This means that the data is not actually removed from the hard drive, but it is no longer accessible and the system considers the space it was using to be free to use again.

To really delete data from a hard drive or other storage device, you would need to use a special tool that actually overwrites the data with new information. This process is called "wiping" the drive, and it is typically done to make sure that the data cannot be recovered by someone else.

So, to explain it like you're five: When you delete a file or empty the recycle bin, it's like the computer is taking a piece of paper and putting it in a special box where it can't be seen anymore. But the paper is still there, and someone could still find it if they really tried. To really get rid of the paper, you would have to take it and write something else on top of it so that the original information can't be read anymore. That's what wiping a drive does.']

id: How do games that run in 30 or 60 FPS record time down to the milisecond ? I 'm mainly asking for the game Mario Kart . I really enjoy it but did n't think of this until recently . Explain like I'm five.

id: How does a turbocharger work in a car ? I understand you can significantly boost the hp of a car with not much weight added with a turbocharger , but what exactly is happening in there that creates that extra power ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
["A turbocharger is a device that helps a car's engine produce more power. It does this by using the energy from the car's exhaust gases to spin a small turbine. This turbine is connected to a compressor, which is a kind of fan. The compressor takes in air from outside the car and blows it into the engine.

The extra air that the compressor blows into the engine allows it to burn more fuel, which creates more power. The more exhaust gases the turbine can spin with, the faster the compressor can blow air into the engine, and the more power the engine can produce.

So, in a nutshell, a turbocharger helps a car's engine make more power by using the energy from the exhaust gases to blow extra air into the engine, which allows it to burn more fuel and create more power."]

This means that the electrical pulses they create may not be exactly the same frequency as they were when the clock was first set. As a result, the clock will slowly lose time.There are also other factors that can cause a digital clock to lose time, such as the battery running low or the clock being exposed to extreme temperatures.To fix this problem, you can simply reset the clock to the correct time. id: How do we calculate the value of fiat money ? I 'm thinking specifically of bitcoin , but any example will make it more clear for me . Explain like I'm five.
text:
["Fiat money is a type of currency that is issued by a government and is not backed by a physical commodity like gold. Instead, the value of fiat money is derived from the faith and credit of the issuing government.

To determine the value of fiat money, we can consider a few different factors:

Supply and demand: Like any other good or service, the value of fiat money is influenced by how much of it is available and how much people want to buy it. If there is more demand for a particular currency than there is supply, the value of that currency may increase.

Economic conditions: The value of a currency may also be influenced by the overall state of the economy. For example, a strong and growing economy may lead to an increase in the value of the currency, while a weak or struggling economy may lead to a decrease in value.

Interest rates: The interest rate set by a government's central bank can also affect the value of a currency. If interest rates are high, people may be more likely to hold onto their currency, which can lead to an increase in value.

Political stability: The stability and reliability of a government can also influence the value of its currency. If a government is perceived as stable and reliable, people may be more likely to trust in the value of its currency and demand it, which can lead to an increase in value.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions."]

id: How does a 3D printer work ? I just ca n't wrap my head around it how hard I try . Explain like I'm five.
text:
["A 3D printer is a machine that can create three-dimensional objects by building them up layer by layer. Here's how it works:

First, you need to design or download a 3D model of the object you want to print. This is usually done using special software on a computer.

Next, you send the 3D model to the 3D printer. The printer reads the model and prepares to start printing.

The printer has a platform that it uses as a base to build the object on. The platform moves up and down as the object is being printed.

The printer has a nozzle, which is a tiny hole that it uses to squirt out a special kind of melted plastic called filament. The nozzle moves around the platform, squirting out the filament in the shape of the object being printed.

As the nozzle squirts out the filament, it builds up layer by layer to create the final object. The printer continues this process until the entire object is complete.

Once the object is finished printing, the printer stops and you can remove the object from the platform.

That's the basic idea behind how a 3D printer works. It's kind of like using a hot glue gun to build something, except the nozzle is much more precise and the object is built up layer by layer instead of all at once."]

id: How does Wikipedia protect itself from malicious pranksters ? If anyone can make edits , I would have thought that a lot more Wikipedia pages would be victims of malicious pranksters . What process safeguards pages from being constantly tampered with or " vandalized " ? Explain like I'm five.
text: ['Wikipedia has several measures in place to protect its pages from being tampered with or vandalized by malicious users. Here are a few of the ways that Wikipedia protects itself: Registration: In order to make edits to Wikipedia, users must first create an account and log in. This helps to deter casual vandals, who may not want to take the time to register an account. Edit filters: Wikipedia has a system called "edit filters" that automatically checks for certain types of edits that are commonly made by vandals. If an edit is flagged by an edit filter, it will be automatically reviewed by a Wikipedia administrator before it is published. Page protection: If a page is frequently vandalized, Wikipedia administrators can "protect" the page, which means that only users with certain privileges (such as administrators) can make edits to it. This helps to prevent malicious edits from being made to important or high-traffic pages. Reverting: If a vandal does manage to make an edit to a Wikipedia page, other users can "revert" the edit, which means that they can undo the changes and restore the page to its previous version. This helps to keep Wikipedia accurate and reliable. Overall, Wikipedia has a number of tools and processes in place to help protect its pages from being vandalized, and the vast majority of edits made to Wikipedia are made by well-intentioned users who are trying to improve the encyclopedia.']

id: How do wireless providers make money from MVNOs ? Would n't creating competition that undersells your own same product while also using your own network be bad for business ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
["Wireless providers, also known as mobile network operators, make money by selling access to their wireless networks to other companies. These companies are called mobile virtual network operators, or MVNOs. MVNOs do not have their own wireless networks and instead, they purchase access to a mobile network operator's network and resell it to their customers under their own brand.

Creating competition through MVNOs can be good for business because it allows the mobile network operator to expand their customer base and potentially increase their revenue. Additionally, MVNOs often target specific customer segments, such as budget-conscious consumers or those who want a specific type of service, which can help the mobile network operator appeal to a wider range of customers.

For example, a mobile network operator might have a brand that primarily targets business customers, while an MVNO that uses their network might focus on offering low-cost plans to budget-conscious consumers. In this way, the mobile network operator can still make money from the MVNO's customers, even if the MVNO's plans are less expensive than the mobile network operator's own plans.

Overall, allowing MVNOs to use their network can be a good way for mobile network operators to increase their revenue and reach a wider range of customers, while still maintaining control over the quality and reliability of their network."]

They will then use various tools and techniques to analyze the software and figure out how it works and how it checks for valid product keys. This can involve disassembling the software's code and examining it, or using specialized software to analyze the software's behavior.

However, creating a keygen is a time-consuming and complex process, and it is not something that can be done in a few hours. It usually takes a significant amount of time and effort to create a keygen for a new piece of software.']

id: How do people with minimum wage jobs get by in cities like NY and LA where the cost of living is so high ? ) ( Please explain like I'm five.

Another way that people with minimum wage jobs can try to get by is by finding ways to make more money. This might involve getting a second job, finding ways to earn extra money on the side, or even starting their own business.

Overall, it can be challenging for people with minimum wage jobs to get by in cities with high costs of living, but with careful planning and hard work, it is possible to make ends meet."]

id: How do stores like Best Buy make money when they sell products like computers or phones without charging extra ? For example , I can order a MacBook for $ 1499 from apple , or from bestbuy for the same price . How does bestbuy make any money ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Best Buy and other stores like it make money by selling products at a price that is higher than the cost they paid to purchase those products from the manufacturer or wholesaler. The difference between the price they sell the product for and the cost they paid is called the "markup."

For example, if Best Buy buys a MacBook from Apple for $1,000 and sells it for $1,499, they are making a markup of $499 on that sale. This markup is how Best Buy makes its profits.

In addition to making money from markups on the products they sell, Best Buy and other stores may also make money from services they provide, such as repair services or installation services. They may also make money from financing plans or other services they offer to customers.

So, even though Best Buy might sell a product like a MacBook for the same price as Apple, they are still making money through the markup they have added to the product, as well as any additional services they might offer.']

id: How do you sail into the wind ? Watching the Olympic sailing reignited my curiosity . I understand the boat zig - zags into a headwind but how do they generate movement in the opposite direction of the wind by doing this ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Sailing into the wind, also called sailing close-hauled, is when a boat is sailing as close as possible to the direction from which the wind is coming. To do this, the boat must sail at an angle to the wind, rather than directly into it.

To understand how this works, imagine that you are holding a piece of paper in your hand. If you blow on the paper, it will move in the direction that you are blowing. This is because the wind is pushing against the paper and causing it to move.

Now imagine that you take that same piece of paper and hold it at an angle to your mouth, so that the wind is blowing against one side of the paper but not the other. If you blow on the paper, it will still move, but it will move in a different direction than if you had held it straight. This is because the wind is pushing against one side of the paper more than the other, causing it to tilt and move in a different direction.

Sailing a boat is similar to this. When the wind is blowing against the sails of a boat, it causes the boat to move in the direction that the wind is coming from. However, if the boat is sailed at an angle to the wind, the wind will push against one side of the sails more than the other, causing the boat to tilt and move in a different direction.

So, to sail into the wind, a boat must sail at an angle to the wind, rather than directly into it. This allows the wind to push against the sails and move the boat in the desired direction, even though it is sailing against the wind.']

id: How do planes fly sideways ? Surely the wind flow over the wings in that case is creating the lift in the horizontal plane , not the vertical , so why does n't it fall out of the sky ? [ Example ] ( URL_0 ) Explain like I'm five.
text: ["Planes are able to fly sideways by using their rudder, which is a hinged surface located at the back of the plane's tail. The pilot can use the rudder to steer the plane left or right by turning it in the desired direction. When a plane is flying straight, the air flows smoothly over the wings from front to back. This creates lift, which is the upward force that keeps the plane in the air. But when a plane is flying sideways, the air doesn't flow smoothly over the wings. Instead, it hits the wings at an angle, which changes the way the lift is generated. Instead of lifting the plane straight up, the lift acts more like a sideways force that pushes the plane in the direction it's moving. Despite this, planes are still able to fly sideways because they are designed to be stable in the air. This means that they are able to maintain their balance and stay in the air even when they are flying at strange angles or in unusual conditions. So to answer your question, planes are able to fly sideways because they are designed to be stable in the air and can use their rudder to steer in different directions."]

id: How do you play Magic : The Gathering ? I 'm referring to the card game , it all looks so technical but I still wanna learn how to play . Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Magic: The Gathering is a strategy card game that involves two or more players. Each player has a deck of cards that represents their arsenal of spells and creatures, and the goal is to reduce the other player's life points to zero before they can do the same to you.

To start a game, each player shuffles their deck and draws seven cards. Each player starts with 20 life points. Players take turns playing cards and using their abilities to attack the other player and their creatures.

On your turn, you have the option to play a land card, which gives you the resources (mana) to play other cards. Then you can play any number of other cards, such as creatures, spells, or enchantments, that have a mana cost written in the top right corner.

Creatures are used to attack the other player and their creatures. When you attack with a creature, the other player can choose to block with one of their own creatures, and the two creatures will "battle" and deal damage to each other.

Spells are one-time abilities that have a variety of effects, such as dealing damage, drawing cards, or destroying creatures. Enchantments are ongoing effects that stay in play until they are removed.

The game continues until one player's life points are reduced to zero, or a player has no cards left in their deck to draw, in which case that player loses.

There are many more rules and complexities to the game, but this is a basic overview of how to play Magic: The Gathering. It can take some time to learn all the different card abilities and strategies, but it can be a lot of fun once you get the hang of it!']

id: How do cruise ships not tip over ? They seem incredibly top heavy and I ca n't imagine how something so big and heavy can keep its balance . Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Cruise ships are designed to be stable and able to stay upright, even in rough seas. They have a number of features that help them stay balanced and prevent them from tipping over.

First, cruise ships are very wide and have a low center of gravity. This means that they have a broad base and a lot of weight distributed evenly from the bottom of the ship to the top. This makes it difficult for the ship to tip over, even if it is hit by large waves or gusts of wind.

Second, cruise ships have a number of stabilizers, which are large fins that can be extended from the sides of the ship. These fins help to keep the ship balanced and stable by countering the motion of the waves.

Finally, cruise ships are also equipped with advanced navigation and control systems that help the crew to keep the ship on course and maintain its balance.

Overall, while cruise ships may seem top heavy and unstable, they are actually designed to be very stable and able to stay upright, even in rough seas.']

id: How do the " trip without acid " videos work ? Why does this effect happen ? Link in comments [ trip without acid example ] ( URL_0 ) Please explain like I'm five.

Persistence of vision is the phenomenon whereby the brain continues to see an image for a short time after the image has been removed from view. This is what allows us to see smooth, continuous motion in films and other forms of moving imagery. In the "trip without acid" videos, the creators use a series of still images or short video clips that are displayed in rapid succession, creating the illusion of a continuous, flowing image. The images are often carefully chosen and arranged to create a sense of movement or change, and they may also use techniques like color shifting or flickering to further enhance the illusion. The effect can be quite striking and can produce a feeling of disorientation or altered consciousness in some viewers. However, it is important to note that the videos do not actually produce any psychoactive effects or alter the viewer\'s mind or consciousness in the same way as drugs like LSD or other psychedelics. The effect is purely visual and does not have any actual psychoactive properties.']

id: How do homeless people generally end up in the inner city ? I never understood how they get there and not like in suburbs or anything . Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Homeless people may end up in the inner city for a variety of reasons. One reason is that the inner city often has more resources available for homeless people, such as shelters, soup kitchens, and social service agencies. These resources may be more difficult to access in suburban or rural areas.

Another reason is that homeless people may have connections to the inner city, such as friends or family members who live there, or they may have spent a lot of time in the inner city before becoming homeless. They may feel more comfortable in the inner city because it is familiar to them.

Additionally, the inner city may have more affordable housing options for homeless people, such as low-income apartments or transitional housing. These options may be harder to come by in more affluent areas.

Finally, some homeless people may be drawn to the inner city because of the availability of services and support, such as mental health care or addiction treatment, that are more readily available in urban areas.']

id: How do carrier pigeons become trained to fly from place to place Seriously did someone tie a bit of string to their foot and walk from place to place till they learned ? How did the senders know that the pigeons were going to the right place ? Please explain like I'm five.
text: ['Carrier pigeons, also known as homing pigeons, are trained to fly from one specific location to another specific location. The process of training carrier pigeons is called pigeon racing. The trainer will then gradually increase the distance that the pigeon flies until it is able to fly long distances. The trainer can tell that the pigeon is going to the right place because the pigeon has been trained to recognize its home loft and will fly directly towards it. When the pigeon arrives at its home loft, the trainer will reward it with food. This helps the pigeon to associate flying home with receiving a reward, which encourages it to continue flying home. Carrier pigeons have been used for many centuries to carry messages, and they are still used today in some parts of the world. They are able to fly long distances, even in bad weather, and they are very good at finding their way home.']

id: How do microwaves work ? I 'm always a little freaked out if I open the microwave door and there is still time left . Explain like I'm five.
text:
["Microwaves are a type of electromagnetic radiation, just like radio waves and light waves. They are a type of energy that travels through the air and can be used to heat up food.

Inside a microwave, there is a special device called a magnetron that generates microwaves. When you turn on the microwave, the magnetron sends out microwaves, which travel through the air and into your food. The microwaves cause the water molecules in your food to vibrate, which creates heat.

When you open the door of the microwave while it is still running, the microwaves stop being produced, so they can't heat up your food anymore. However, the heat that was already produced inside the food will continue to be distributed, so the food may still feel warm even after the microwaves have stopped.

So, in short, microwaves work by using special waves of energy to heat up food, and you can stop the microwaves from working by opening the door of the microwave."]

id: How do you drive a stick - shift ? ? keep in mind i 'm only 5 years old Explain like I'm five.
text: ['Driving a stick shift can be a little tricky at first, but with some practice, you can learn how to do it! Here\'s how: Start by sitting in the driver\'s seat and putting on your seatbelt. Put the car in "neutral" by pressing down on the clutch pedal (the one on the left) and shifting the gear stick into the middle position. Turn the key in the ignition to start the engine. Press down on the brake pedal (the one on the right) and shift the gear stick into first gear. Slowly let go of the clutch pedal while pressing down on the gas pedal (the one in the middle). This will make the car start to move. When you want to change gears, press down on the clutch pedal and move the gear stick to the next gear you want. For example, if you want to go faster, you can shift into second gear. When you\'re ready to stop the car, press down on the brake pedal and shift the gear stick back into neutral. Remember to always use the clutch pedal when shifting gears, and try to be smooth with your movements. With some practice, driving a stick shift will become easier and you\'ll be able to do it like a pro!']

During this test, a small amount of an allergen (such as a substance that a person might be allergic to) is placed on the skin, and then a needle is used to prick the skin through the allergen. If the person is allergic to the allergen, they will develop a raised bump or rash on their skin. \nAnother way to test for allergies is to do a blood test. During this test, a blood sample is taken from the person and sent to a laboratory, where it is tested for the presence of antibodies to specific allergens. Antibodies are proteins produced by the body's immune system in response to an allergen. If the person has allergies, their blood will contain high levels of these antibodies. \nIt's important to note that doctors do not usually test for allergies by exposing a person to the allergen directly. This is because allergies can cause serious reactions, such as difficulty breathing or a drop in blood pressure, and it would be dangerous to intentionally trigger these reactions. Instead, doctors use safer methods, such as skin prick tests and blood tests, to test for allergies."]

id: How do you calculate the P/E ratio by industry?
text: ["To calculate the price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio by industry, you will need to follow these steps:Determine the current market price of a company's stock. This can be found on a financial news website or through a stock market trading platform.Calculate the company's earnings per share (EPS) over the past 12 months. EPS is a company's profits divided by the number of outstanding shares of stock.Divide the market price per share by the EPS to calculate the P/E ratio. For example, if a company's stock is trading at $50 per share and its EPS is $5, the P/E ratio would be 10.To compare the P/E ratio of a company to its industry average, you can use financial websites or industry reports that provide P/E ratios for a range of companies within the same industry. This will give you an idea of whether the company's P/E ratio is higher or lower than its industry peers.Keep in mind that the P/E ratio can vary significantly between industries, so it is important to compare a company's P/E ratio to those of its industry peers rather than to the market as a whole."]

id: How do credit card banks detect fraudulent transactions without requiring a travel advisory?
text: ['Credit card banks have several ways to detect fraudulent transactions without requiring a travel advisory. Here are some examples:Fraud monitoring systems: Credit card banks use specialized software to monitor transactions for suspicious activity. These systems are designed to flag transactions that are out of the ordinary for a particular cardholder, such as a sudden change in spending patterns or a purchase made in an unfamiliar location.Cardholder verification: Credit card banks may use additional measures to verify the identity of the cardholder before approving a transaction. This can include asking for a PIN, a one-time code sent via text message, or biometric authentication such as fingerprint or facial recognition.Merchant verification: Credit card banks may also verify the identity of the merchant before approving a transaction. This can include checking that the merchant is registered with the card issuer and verifying their business details.Machine learning: Credit card banks may use machine learning algorithms to analyze patterns in past fraudulent transactions and use this information to flag potentially fraudulent transactions in the future.Overall, credit card banks use a combination of these and other methods to detect fraudulent transactions and protect their customers from fraud.']

id: How do we keep track of time ? It just does n't make sense to me , how did we standardize the second . The amount of time in a second all depends on the counter ... how did we set an exact length ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Time is a measure of the duration of an event or the interval between two events. It is a fundamental quantity in physics and is used to describe the motion and changes of objects.

To keep track of time, we use devices called clocks. Clocks work by measuring the regular, repeating movements of an object. For example, a clock can measure the regular swinging of a pendulum or the regular vibrations of a crystal. By counting the number of swings or vibrations, a clock can keep track of the passage of time.

The standard unit of time is the second. A second is defined as the duration of 9,192,631,770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium-133 atom. This definition of the second was adopted by the International System of Units (SI) in 1967.

The second is a very small unit of time. It is used to measure much shorter intervals of time, such as the time it takes for light to travel a distance of about a foot (0.3 meters). Because the second is so small, we often use larger units of time, such as minutes, hours, and days, to measure longer intervals.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.']

id: How does NAT ( Network Address Translation ) work . I 've googled it and all the answers are very complex . I need it explained to me like I 'm five . Thanks ! Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Sure! NAT (Network Address Translation) is a way that computers on a private network can communicate with computers on the internet.

Imagine you have a group of friends who all live in the same apartment building. Inside the building, you can all communicate with each other just fine. But if you want to talk to a friend who lives in a different building, you need to go outside and use a special telephone that connects to the outside world.

In a similar way, computers on a private network (like your apartment building) need a way to communicate with computers on the internet (like your friend in a different building). NAT helps these computers communicate by acting like a special telephone that connects them to the internet.

When a computer on a private network wants to communicate with a computer on the internet, it sends a message to NAT. NAT looks at the message and sees where it needs to go. Then NAT sends the message out to the internet, using its own special internet address. When the message reaches the computer on the internet, it knows to send a reply back to NAT. NAT then sends the reply back to the original computer on the private network.

This way, computers on the private network can communicate with computers on the internet, even though they don't have their own internet addresses. NAT helps them "hide" behind a single internet address, just like you can use the special telephone to talk to your friend even though you don't have your own phone line.']

id: How do we get cancer ? It is all about diet , genetics , posion or just bad luck ? My dad survived cancer and i 'm just curious about how people get cancer Explain like I'm five.
text:
["Cancer is a type of disease that occurs when cells in the body start growing and multiplying in an uncontrolled way. There are many different types of cancer, and they can occur in almost any part of the body.

There are a number of different things that can increase the risk of someone developing cancer. These include:

Genetics: Some people are more likely to develop cancer because they have inherited certain genes from their parents that make them more susceptible to the disease.

Diet: Some studies have suggested that a diet high in certain types of food, such as processed meat and red meat, can increase the risk of cancer.

Environmental factors: Exposure to certain substances, such as tobacco smoke, radiation, and certain chemicals, can increase the risk of cancer.

Medical conditions: Some medical conditions, such as HIV/AIDS and certain types of autoimmune diseases, can also increase the risk of cancer.

Bad luck: In some cases, cancer may develop simply due to random events that happen within the body.

It's important to note that not everyone who has one or more of these risk factors will develop cancer. There is no sure way to prevent cancer, but there are things that you can do to reduce your risk, such as eating a healthy diet, avoiding tobacco and excessive alcohol consumption, and getting regular check-ups and screenings."]

These histamines cause symptoms such as itching, redness, and swelling on your skin. In the case of a nickel allergy, the rash that forms on your skin is a result of the histamines that your body released in response to the presence of nickel. When you come into contact with nickel, your immune system recognizes it as a foreign substance and tries to protect you by releasing histamines. The histamines then cause the blood vessels in your skin to become inflamed, leading to redness, swelling, and itching. It's important to note that not everyone who comes into contact with nickel will develop an allergy. Additionally, the severity of a metal allergy can vary from person to person, with some people experiencing mild symptoms while others may have more severe reactions."]

id: How does a Transistor work and why is it so important ? According to a recent ask reddit thread , most people do n't know what a Transistor is , and apparently the transistor is the building block of modern tech . Help ! Explain like I'm five.
text: ['\\nA transistor is a tiny electronic device that can be used to amplify or switch electrical signals. It is made up of three layers of a special type of semiconductor material, which are sandwiched together to form a channel through which electricity can flow.\\n\\nThe first layer is called the base, the second layer is called the collector, and the third layer is called the emitter. When a small amount of electricity is applied to the base of the transistor, it allows a larger amount of electricity to flow through the collector and emitter.\\n\\nTransistors are important because they can be used to control the flow of electricity in a circuit, which makes it possible to build all kinds of electronic devices. They are the building blocks of modern technology because they are used in almost all electronic devices, from computers and smartphones to TVs and radios.\\n\\nTransistors are also very small and can be packed together in large numbers on a tiny chip, which makes it possible to build very complex electronic circuits in a small space. This is why transistors are essential for modern technology and why they are found in almost all electronic devices.']

id: How do geosynchronous orbits occur without falling to earth ? My knowledge of an orbit is an object continually falling toward earth but going fast enough to cancel out earth 's curvature . So , how can geosynchronous orbits exist without the satellite falling to earth ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Sure! Geosynchronous orbits are a type of orbit where a satellite orbits the Earth at the same speed that the Earth is turning. This means that the satellite stays in the same position above the Earth's surface at all times.

To understand how this works, it's helpful to think about how the Earth's gravity works. Gravity is what keeps objects stuck to the Earth's surface and what makes things fall down. The Earth's gravity also reaches out into space, and it pulls on satellites and other objects that are orbiting the Earth.

If a satellite is orbiting the Earth and it's moving too slowly, then the Earth's gravity will pull it down and it will fall back to the surface. But if the satellite is moving fast enough, it will be able to stay in orbit and keep going around and around the Earth. The speed that a satellite needs to go in order to stay in orbit is called the "escape velocity."

For a satellite to be in a geosynchronous orbit, it needs to be in a very specific spot in space and it needs to be moving at a very specific speed. If it's not in the right spot or moving at the right speed, then it won't be able to stay in a geosynchronous orbit and it will either fall back to the Earth or fly off into space.']

The tampon feels full: When a tampon is inserted, it should feel comfortable and not too tight. If a woman notices that the tampon feels full or uncomfortable, it may be time to change it.

Let's say that the bank charges the borrower 10% interest on the loan. That means that the borrower has to pay the bank back $110 (the original $100 plus the $10 interest).

When the borrower pays the money back to the bank, the bank gets to keep the interest as profit. In this example, the bank made a profit of $10. The bank can use this profit to pay its employees, cover its operating costs, and make more loans to other people.

So, in short, banks make money by charging interest on the money they lend out to borrowers.']

['pH stands for "potential of hydrogen" and is a measure of the acidity or basicity (alkalinity) of a solution. The pH scale ranges from 0 to 14, with 7 being neutral. A solution with a pH less than 7 is considered acidic, while a solution with a pH greater than 7 is considered basic or alkaline.

The reason why a change in pH by one unit (for example, going from pH 7 to pH 8) is not considered a "simple" increase by one is because the pH scale is logarithmic. This means that each unit on the pH scale represents a tenfold difference in acidity or basicity. For example, a solution with a pH of 4 is ten times more acidic than a solution with a pH of 5, and 100 times more acidic than a solution with a pH of 6. Similarly, a solution with a pH of 9 is ten times more basic than a solution with a pH of 8, and 100 times more basic than a solution with a pH of 7.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.']

id: How do calculators figure out the square roots of numbers ? I understand how you can find exponents of numbers by multiplying it by itself that many times , but how do they determine roots of numbers ? Explain like I'm five.
text:
['Calculators use an algorithm called the "Newton-Raphson method" to find the square root of a number. This algorithm works by starting with an initial guess for the square root, and then repeatedly improving the guess using a formula until the guess is accurate enough. Here's how it works:

Imagine you want to find the square root of a number, let's call it X. First, you need to make an initial guess for the square root. This guess doesn't have to be very accurate, it just needs to be close.

Next, you use the following formula to improve your guess:

guess = (guess + (X / guess)) / 2

This formula takes your current guess, and then adds X divided by the guess, and then divides that number by 2. This gives you a new, improved guess for the square root.

You can then repeat this process as many times as you want, using your new guess as the input each time. Each time you repeat the process, your guess will become more and more accurate. Eventually, your guess will be accurate enough, and you can stop the process.

That's the basic idea behind the Newton-Raphson method for finding square roots. It's a bit complicated, but it's a very efficient way for a calculator to find the square root of a number.']
